verses.verse: But now they that are younger <WH6810> <WH3117> than I have me in derision <WH7832>, whose fathers <WH1> I would have disdained <WH3988> to have set <WH7896> with the dogs <WH3611> of my flock <WH6629>. younger: Heb. of fewer days than I
Yea, whereto <WH4100> might the strength <WH3581> of their hands <WH3027> profit me, in whom old age <WH3624> was perished <WH6>?

For want <WH2639> and famine <WH3720> they were solitary <WH1565>; fleeing <WH6207> into the wilderness <WH6723> in former time <WH570> desolate <WH7722> and waste <WH4875>. solitary: or, dark as the night in: Heb. yesternight
Who cut up <WH6998> mallows <WH4408> by the bushes <WH7880>, and juniper <WH7574> roots <WH8328> for their meat <WH3899>.
They were driven forth <WH1644> from among <WH1460> men, (they cried <WH7321> after them as after a thief <WH1590>;)
To dwell <WH7931> in the clifts <WH6178> of the valleys <WH5158>, in caves <WH2356> of the earth <WH6083>, and in the rocks <WH3710>. caves: Heb. holes
Among the bushes <WH7880> they brayed <WH5101>; under the nettles <WH2738> they were gathered together <WH5596>.
They were children <WH1121> of fools <WH5036>, yea, children <WH1121> of base men <WH8034>: they were viler <WH5217> than the earth <WH776>. base: Heb. men of no name
And now am I their song <WH5058>, yea, I am their byword <WH4405>.
They abhor <WH8581> me, they flee far <WH7368> from me, and spare <WH2820> not to spit <WH7536> in my face <WH6440>. and: Heb. and withhold not spittle from
Because he hath loosed <WH6605> my cord <WH3499>, and afflicted <WH6031> me, they have also let loose <WH7971> the bridle <WH7448> before <WH6440> me.
Upon my right <WH3225> hand rise <WH6965> the youth <WH6526>; they push away <WH7971> my feet <WH7272>, and they raise up <WH5549> against me the ways <WH734> of their destruction <WH343>.
They mar <WH5420> my path <WH5410>, they set forward <WH3276> my calamity <WH1942> <WH1962>, they have no helper <WH5826>.
They came <WH857> upon me as a wide <WH7342> breaking <WH6556> in of waters: in <WH8478> the desolation <WH7722> they rolled <WH1556> themselves upon me.

Terrors <WH1091> are turned <WH2015> upon me: they pursue <WH7291> my soul <WH5082> as the wind <WH7307>: and my welfare <WH3444> passeth away <WH5674> as a cloud <WH5645>. my soul: Heb. my principal one
And now my soul <WH5315> is poured out <WH8210> upon me; the days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> have taken hold <WH270> upon me.
My bones <WH6106> are pierced <WH5365> in me in the night season <WH3915>: and my sinews <WH6207> take no rest <WH7901>.
By the great <WH7230> force <WH3581> of my disease is my garment <WH3830> changed <WH2664>: it bindeth me about <WH247> as the collar <WH6310> of my coat <WH3801>.
He hath cast <WH3384> me into the mire <WH2563>, and I am become like <WH4911> dust <WH6083> and ashes <WH665>.
I cry <WH7768> unto thee, and thou dost not hear <WH6030> me: I stand up <WH5975>, and thou regardest <WH995> me not.
Thou art become <WH2015> cruel <WH393> to me: with thy strong <WH6108> hand <WH3027> thou opposest <WH7852> thyself against me. become: Heb. turned to be cruel thy: Heb. the strength of thy hand
Thou liftest me up <WH5375> to the wind <WH7307>; thou causest me to ride <WH7392> upon it, and dissolvest <WH4127> my substance <WH8454> <WH7738>. substance: or, wisdom
For I know <WH3045> that thou wilt bring <WH7725> me to death <WH4194>, and to the house <WH1004> appointed <WH4150> for all living <WH2416>.
Howbeit he will not stretch out <WH7971> his hand <WH3027> to the grave <WH1164>, though they cry <WH7769> in his destruction <WH6365>. grave: Heb. heap
Did not I weep <WH1058> for him that was in trouble <WH7186> <WH3117>? was not my soul <WH5315> grieved <WH5701> for the poor <WH34>? in trouble: Heb. hard of day?
When I looked <WH6960> for good <WH2896>, then evil <WH7451> came <WH935> unto me: and when I waited <WH3176> for light <WH216>, there came <WH935> darkness <WH652>.
My bowels <WH4578> boiled <WH7570>, and rested <WH1826> not: the days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> prevented <WH6923> me.
I went <WH1980> mourning <WH6937> without the sun <WH2535>: I stood up <WH6965>, and I cried <WH7768> in the congregation <WH6951>.
I am a brother <WH251> to dragons <WH8577>, and a companion <WH7453> to owls <WH1323> <WH3284>. owls: or, ostriches
My skin <WH5785> is black <WH7835> upon me, and my bones <WH6106> are burned <WH2787> with heat <WH2721>.
My harp <WH3658> also is turned to mourning <WH60>, and my organ <WH5748> into the voice <WH6963> of them that weep <WH1058>.
